Description: Base and body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery stemless cup; low disc foot; interior: five wide concentric black bands; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of sphinx or siren (tail and one foot remaining), to left; in centre, part of waterfowl (tail and two legs remaining), to right; at right, three legs and paw of feline, to left; below, three narrow bands.
Curator's comments: For the shape, see Agora XII, no. 449 (P 24589) pl. 21 and fig. 5 (stemless cup with bevelled base, dated about 500-480 BC). For the concentric bands, see Callipolitis-Feytmans, D., Les Plats attiques à figures noires. Paris 1974, pl. Athens MN 509. See also the Ionian cup, Munich 529, dated 560-540 BC in Vierneisel, K. and Kaeser, B., Kunst der Schale. Kultur des Trinkens. Munich 1990, 56, no. 6.1.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0681) (Phase 1)
